algorithm_technique: Count divisors by iterating up to the square root of n.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a number has exactly three positive divisors.
problem_summary_technical: Count divisors by checking divisibility up to the square root of n. A number with exactly three divisors must be the square of a prime number.
key_insights: A number with exactly three divisors must be the square of a prime number.
Iterating up to the square root of n efficiently counts divisors.
Care must be taken to count perfect squares correctly (i.e., not double-counting the square root). The provided solution counts divisors by pairs (i, n/i) and handles perfect squares.
